00016 class PhysEventManager
00017 {
00018         private:
00019                 list<PhysEvent*> EventQueue;
00020         static bool IgnoreSDLQuitEvents;
00021 
00022         public:
00023                 PhysEventManager();
00024 
00025         //These functions will give you the next event or help you manage the events
00026         //Whenever and event is gotten it is removed form the event queue
00027         //any getfunction cannot find an appropriate event it returns a pointer to 0
00028         unsigned int GetRemainingEventCount();
00029                 PhysEvent* GetNextEvent();
00030 
00031                 //This gets the first/next available PhysEventRenderTime* in the Queue, then removes it.
00032                 PhysEventRenderTime* GetNextRenderTimeEvent();
00033         PhysEventUserInput* GetNextUserInputEvent();
00034 
00035         //By and large the Game won't use this, but there is no reason it shouldn't
00036                 void AddEvent(PhysEvent* EventToAdd);
00037 
00038         //different platforms treat exiting the application differently, to work around that
00039         //we can use this to help identify if it comes accross as a normal event, or if we must
00040         //quit without generating one
00041         bool DoQuitMessagesExist();
00042         static bool IgnoreQuitEvents();                //if true, don't exit
00043         static void SetIgnoreQuitEvents(bool Ignore);  //if false exit when x is clicked.
00044 
00045 };
